description: This file defines a React component called DashboardPage that serves as a user interface for mechanics to view and accept service requests. It manages state for request data, loading and error handling, and user interactions like accepting requests. It also includes utility functions for displaying vehicle info and request statuses.

methods.name: statusBadge(status)
methods.description: Generates a visual badge component for a given status, applying styles and labels based on statusUtils.

methods.name: renderVehicleCell(vehicle)
methods.description: Constructs a string label for a vehicle combining make and model, with fallback to placeholder if data is missing.

methods.name: DashboardPage({ user })
methods.description: Main React functional component that displays available requests to mechanics, allows accepting requests, and handles interactions and UI updates.

ctags.name: [ { key: "id", header: "Request", render: (r) => <Link className="link" to={`/requests/${r.id}`}>{r.id.slice(0, 8)}</ { key: "createdAt", header: "Created", render: (r) => new Date(r.createdAt).toLocaleString() }, { key: "vehicle", header: "Vehicle", render: (r) => renderVehicleCell(r.vehicle), }, { key: "status", header: "Status", render: (r) => statusBadge(r.status) }, { key: "action", header: "Action", render: (r) => ( <Button size="sm" onClick={() => accept(r.id)} disabled={busyId === r.id}> {busyId === r.id ? "Accepting..." : "Accept"} </ ), }, ]
